edu.calpoly.spritely

Class AnimationFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calpoly.spritely.AnimationFrame

  • public final class AnimationFrame
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of one frame of animation in a SpriteWindow. By default, Spritely offers to show 30 frames each second. An AnimationFrame is given to client code by a SpriteWindow for each frame of animation. The client works by adding tiles to a grid maintained by the AnimationFrame.
    See Also:
    SpriteWindow.waitForNextFrame(), SpriteWindow.showNextFrame()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTile(int x, int y, Tile tile)
      Add the given tile to the grid being shown in this animation frame.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • addTile

        public void addTile(int x,
                    int y,
                    Tile tile)
        Add the given tile to the grid being shown in this animation frame. Each grid square may contain any number of overlapping tiles. The first tile added is placed on the bottom, and subsequent tiles are drawn on top of that, in order. In text mode, only the topmost tile can be seen.
        Parameters:
        x - The column of the tile, 0-based, counting from the left
        y - The row of the tile, 0-based counting from the top
        tile - The tile to show at x,y.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x, y are out of range.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this frame has been shown
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if tile is null
        See Also:
        SpriteWindow.waitForNextFrame(), SpriteWindow.showNextFrame()
